conclusion: To determine how the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will change when the light source moves to the right, analyze each object and its shadow step by step.
The light source moves to the right, meaning the shadows will shift to the left relative to the objects.
Object A is a cake, and its shadow (A) is currently cast to the right of the object.
The shadow of the cake will move to the left of the cake when the light source moves to the right.
The shadow of the cake will likely become larger as the light source moves higher and to the right.
Object B is a postcard, and its shadow (B) is currently cast to the right of the object.
The shadow of the postcard will shift to the left of the postcard when the light source moves to the right.
The shadow of the postcard will also become larger due to the increased angle of the light source.
Object C is a scroll, and its shadow (C) is currently cast to the right of the object.
The shadow of the scroll will move to the left of the scroll when the light source moves to the right.
The shadow of the scroll will grow larger as the light source moves to the right and higher.
Object D is a soccer ball, and its shadow (D) is currently cast to the right of the object.
The shadow of the soccer ball will shift to the left of the soccer ball when the light source moves to the right.
The shadow of the soccer ball will become larger due to the new angle and position of the light source.
All shadows will move to the left of their respective objects when the light source moves to the right.
All shadows will become larger when the light source moves to the right.
When the light source moves to the right, the shadows (A, B, C, and D) will shift to the left and will become larger.
